page.title: 14Settlements-Bramshott
page.content: { Bramshott}is a small village situated in{Hampshire.}It appears to be reasonably affluent, having numerous detached houses, many with 3 or more bedrooms. Solid fuel is the most popular type of heating in this area as oil is becoming increasingly expensive. The gardens are usually large, very few houses have no garden space. Most houses have double garages though a few have single garages. Telephones and televisions are very common, quite a few people own a video recorder. The church at{Bramshott}dates back to {Norman}times, 1220 in fact. Originally it was Catholic but since then it has become Church of England. The central tower was altered in 1400. The wooden spire is 15th century and there is also the remains of a 15th century window in the west wall. The windows
